  • Method Details

    • stepsTest

      @Test public void stepsTest()
      Method stepsTest() tests how many steps are added to Mother Nature in a turn. Expected result is 2.

    • costTest

      @Test public void costTest()
      Method costTest() tests if the initial cost is set correctly. Expected result is 1. After calling increaseCost(), the cost is expected to increase by one.

    • influenceTest

      @Test public void influenceTest()
      Method tests whether StepsCharacterCardTest has any effect on the influence. Return is expected to be 0.

    • effectProfessorTest

      @Test public void effectProfessorTest()
      Method effectProfessorTest() tests the outcome of calling effectPlayerProfessor on a StepsCharacterCard class. The expected result is that a player has to have greater students than any other player.

    • initialEffectTest

      @ParameterizedTest @ValueSource(ints={2,3}) public void initialEffectTest(int numOfPlayers)
      Method initialEffectTest() tests the method applyInitialEffect(). A true return is expected.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - number of players in the game

    • applyTest1

      @ParameterizedTest @ValueSource(ints={2,3}) public void applyTest1(int numOfPlayers)
      Method applyTest1() tests the method applyEffect(Game game, Island island). The return is expected to be false.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - number of players in the game

    • applyTest2

      @ParameterizedTest @ValueSource(ints={2,3}) public void applyTest2(int numOfPlayers)
      Method applyTest2() tests the method applyEffect(Game game, StudentContainer sc, int[] stud1, int[] stud2). A false return is expected.
      Parameters:
      numOfPlayers - number of players in the game

    • createPlayers

      public it.polimi.ingsw.model.player.Player[] createPlayers()
      Method creates an array of Players. This methods serves as a shortcut for some tests.

      array of Players
